intro: Macrostylis lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate macrostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in coastal regions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a unique arrangement of stamens that set it apart from other species in the genus. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
